title: error from missing `?` is quite confusing

labels.name: A-diagnostics
labels.description: Area: Messages for errors, warnings, and lints

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

labels.name: E-needs-mcve
labels.description: Call for participation: This issue needs a Minimal Complete and Verifiable Example

body:
Given the code on [branch issue-86508](https://github.com/nikomatsakis/optopodi/tree/issue-86508) in the repo https://github.com/nikomatsakis/optopodi, with this function:

```rust
#[async_trait]
impl GQL for octocrab::Octocrab {
    async fn graphql_raw<R: octocrab::FromResponse>(
        &self,
        body: &(impl serde::Serialize + ?Sized),
    ) -> octocrab::Result<R> {
        self.post("graphql", Some(&body)).await?
    }
}
```

The current output is:

```
error[E0277]: the trait bound `R: Deserialize<'_>` is not satisfied
  --> src/metrics/list_repos.rs:90:14
   |
90 |         self.post("graphql", Some(&body)).await?
   |              ^^^^ the trait `Deserialize<'_>` is not implemented for `R`
   |
   = note: required because of the requirements on the impl of `for<'de> Deserialize<'de>` for `std::result::Result<R, octocrab::Error>`
   = note: required because of the requirements on the impl of `DeserializeOwned` for `std::result::Result<R, octocrab::Error>`
   = note: required because of the requirements on the impl of `FromResponse` for `std::result::Result<R, octocrab::Error>`
help: consider further restricting this bound
   |
86 |     async fn graphql_raw<R + Deserialize<'_>: octocrab::FromResponse>(
   |                            ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^
```

The fix to make the code compile (well, at least to get to a different error) is to either remove the `?` or else write `Ok(self.post(...).await?)`. This error was not especially helpful towards figuring that out!

I believe the error comes about because the [`post` method from octocrab](https://docs.rs/octocrab/0.9.1/octocrab/struct.Octocrab.html#method.post) returns a `Result<?X>`, where `?X` is here getting inferred to `octocrab::Result<R>`, and .. yeah well I don't know for sure what the reasoning is. =)

Apologies that I wasn't able to reduce to a self-standing repo yet.
